column4: Hello! I just tried to install ubuntu along windows on my laptop.  Ubuntu did not detect my hard drive (perhaps because ih ave a RAID 0 configuration?) but detected my external hard drive and installed to that.  Now, I can't boot into windows.  It still won't detect my internal hard drive, and the boot loader doesnt recognize windows, either
what error do you get? Missing MBR?
I thought you said you couldn't boot windows? You need to be more specific as to what the problem is.

ah right. Well your options are 1) Investigate why ubuntu can't see windows (often it's just a dirty NTFS journal) and then add it as an option in GRUB, or 2) Find a windows CD and have it overwrite your MBR
